study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy of para-sacral transcutaneous electric nerve stimulation (PS-TENS) in treating primary and refractory overactive bladder (OAB) in children.
results_summary: PS-TENS significantly reduced urge incontinence in both primary and refractory OAB groups, improved micturition frequency in primary OAB, and increased bladder capacity while reducing resting detrusor pressure in refractory OAB. The magnitude of improvement was higher in primary OAB compared to refractory OAB.
population_specificity: Children aged 5-12 years with primary or refractory OAB.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the therapeutic efficacy and safety of low-frequency transcutaneous electric nerve stimulation (LF-TENS) as an alternative treatment for insomnia disorder.
results_summary: The study found no significant overall differences between the active and sham device groups in mood, sleep parameters, or blood tests. However, in patients aged over 60, the active device group showed better improvement in sleep quality (PSQI score) and cortisol levels. No serious adverse reactions were reported.
population_specificity: Individuals aged 40 to 80 years with insomnia disorder, with a subgroup analysis for those over 60.
effective_dosage: Device used more than five days a week (specific dosage not detailed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether Acu-TENS could improve patient tolerance and success rates during non-sedated elective diagnostic OGDS.
results_summary: Acu-TENS significantly improved OGDS success rates (77.8% vs. 68.0%) and patient willingness for future procedures (78.9% vs. 68.6%), while reducing procedure duration (6.0 min vs. 10.0 min) with no reported adverse effects.
population_specificity: Adults aged 18-75 years scheduled for their first elective diagnostic OGDS.
study_duration: Duration of the OGDS procedure (intervention arm: 6.0 min, placebo arm: 10.0 min)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effect of electroanalgesia via TENS on pain and lung function in the postoperative period of bariatric surgery.
results_summary: TENS reduced pain significantly compared to placebo (p = 0.001) and maintained maximal inspiratory pressure (MIP) in the intervention group, though it did not improve spirometric parameters. The placebo group showed decreased MIP and increased respiratory rate during TENS application.
population_specificity: 66 subjects who underwent bariatric surgery, randomized into intervention (n = 33) and placebo (n = 33) groups.
study_duration: Not specified (duration per session not mentioned).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of high-frequency and low-frequency Transcutaneous Electric Nerve Stimulation (TENS) in treating venous ulcers.
results_summary: The study found that low-frequency TENS (L-TENS) significantly reduced wound surface area, wound volume, and pain compared to high-frequency TENS (H-TENS) and routine care alone, with statistically significant results (P <0.05) after 4 and 8 weeks of treatment. L-TENS was recommended as more effective for venous ulcer treatment.
population_specificity: Sixty patients with venous ulcers, divided into three groups (control, H-TENS, L-TENS).
effective_dosage: H-TENS: 80-120 Hz, 15-30 amp, 250 µs pulse duration, 60 min/session; L-TENS: 1-5 Hz, 30-80 amp, 250 µs pulse duration, 60 min/session.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of back exercises and transcutaneous electrical nerve stimulation (TENS) on pain and disability in operating room nurses with chronic nonspecific low back pain.
results_summary: Both back exercises and TENS significantly reduced pain and disability, but TENS showed greater improvements in pain and disability scores compared to back exercises. The differences were statistically significant and clinically meaningful.
population_specificity: Operating room nurses (30 women, 14 men, mean age 37.86 ± 6.74) with chronic nonspecific low back pain.
effective_dosage: Three sessions of 15 minutes per week for 6 weeks.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to summarize existing evidence and evaluate the effectiveness of Electric Nerve Stimulation (ENS) for Overactive Bladder (OAB) using an umbrella review methodology.
results_summary: ENS appears effective and safe for OAB, with weak evidence of clinical efficacy and no evidence of side effects, though more high-quality research is needed to confirm these findings.
population_specificity: 5004 participants across 89 randomized controlled trials and 16 prospective cohort studies.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the impact of shoulder transcutaneous electric nerve stimulation (TENS) on heart rate and vagal tone, assessing its potential as a non-invasive therapy for heart failure.
results_summary: TENS-R consistently decreased heart rate, while TENS-L had a transient effect; both increased low- and high-frequency spectral power. TENS-L also raised the low/high-frequency power ratio, suggesting vagal tone potentiation, indicating potential therapeutic benefits for heart failure.
population_specificity: Subjects (specific population not detailed in abstract)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether transcutaneous electrical nerve stimulation (TENS) reduces anxiety and fear during dental procedures in children.
results_summary: TENS showed a statistically significant reduction in anxiety and fear (p < 0.01) compared to pre-treatment levels, though no significant difference was found across all subjects (p > 0.05). Local anesthesia also showed significant effects (p < 0.05).
population_specificity: 125 children aged 9-14 years.
study_duration: Single visit (implied by "after the first visit")

study_goal: To determine if short-term high-frequency Transcutaneous Electric Nerve Stimulation effectively relieves rest pain in patients with chronic limb-threatening ischemia compared to a sham intervention.
results_summary: Both Transcutaneous Electric Nerve Stimulation and sham groups showed significant pain reduction (54% and 55%, respectively), but no statistically significant difference was found between the two interventions.
population_specificity: Patients ≥18 years old with chronic limb-threatening ischemia and rest pain ≥3 on the Visual Analogue Scale, excluding those with diabetic neuropathy.
effective_dosage: 100 Hz, 200 μs, one or two 20-minute sessions.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy of Transcutaneous Electrical Nerve Stimulation (TENS) and Soft Tissue Massage (STM) in managing Hemiplegic Shoulder Pain (HSP) in stroke patients.
results_summary: Both TENS and STM significantly reduced HSP, but TENS showed greater effectiveness in post-treatment comparisons. The study concluded that TENS is more effective than STM for HSP modulation.
population_specificity: Stroke patients with Hemiplegic Shoulder Pain (HSP).
effective_dosage: 16 sessions administered on subscapularis, supraspinatus, and posterior deltoid muscles (specific TENS parameters not detailed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy of low-level laser therapy (LLLT) with different wavelengths and transcutaneous electric nerve stimulation (TENS) for pain relief in temporomandibular disorders (TMD).
results_summary: The study found that LLLT, particularly with wavelengths ranging from 910 nm to 1100 nm, provided better short-term pain relief than TENS, though no significant difference was observed after one-month follow-up. TENS was less effective compared to higher-wavelength LLLT.
population_specificity: Patients with temporomandibular disorders (TMD) (969 participants across 27 RCTs).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness and safety of transcutaneous electrical nerve stimulation (TENS) in reducing postoperative pain and analgesic use after open inguinal hernia repair.
results_summary: The study found that TENS significantly reduced pain scores and analgesic requirements compared to placebo, with higher pressure pain thresholds post-procedure in the TENS group. The results were statistically significant (P< .001) and clinically relevant.
population_specificity: 80 male participants undergoing elective primary unilateral hernia Lichtenstein repair.
effective_dosage: Local and segmental conventional TENS on the first and second postoperative days (intensity not specified beyond placebo being 0-0.5mA).
study_duration: Two days (first and second postoperative days).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy and safety of transcutaneous electric nerve stimulation (TENS) for acute low back pain (LBP).
results_summary: One low-quality trial showed clinically significant pain relief with a short TENS session during emergency transport, while two other studies provided inconclusive evidence for longer-term TENS use. The overall evidence was insufficient to support or dismiss TENS for acute LBP.
population_specificity: Patients with moderate to severe acute low back pain.
effective_dosage: ~30 min treatment in emergency setting; 4-5 weeks course in other settings.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy and safety of transcutaneous posterior tibial nerve stimulation (TPTNS) for treating premature ejaculation (PE).
results_summary: TPTNS therapy resulted in a significant increase in intravaginal ejaculation latency time (IELT), with 54.5% of participants achieving a threefold increase at week 12. The treatment showed sustained efficacy over follow-up periods, with minimal adverse effects reported.
population_specificity: Twelve men with lifelong premature ejaculation and no prior treatment (11 completed the study).
effective_dosage: 30-minute sessions of 20 Hz stimulation with a pulse amplitude of 200 µsec, adjusted based on individual sensibility, administered 3 times weekly for 12 weeks.
study_duration: 12 weeks of therapy, with follow-up continued for 9 months post-therapy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to systematically evaluate the efficacy of Acu-TENS (Transcutaneous Electric Nerve Stimulation over acupoints) for treating diarrhea-predominant irritable bowel syndrome (IBS-D).
results_summary: The study planned to assess Acu-TENS's effects on stool frequency, pain (VAS), stool consistency (Bristol scale), quality of life (SF-36, IBS-QOL), symptom severity (IBS-SSS), and rectal perception, but results were not yet available as this was a protocol for a systematic review.
population_specificity: Patients with diarrhea-predominant irritable bowel syndrome (IBS-D).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness and safety of TENS and MENS in treating temporomandibular disorders (TMDs), particularly in improving functional mouth opening and pain relief.
results_summary: MENS showed better and immediate pain relief, especially in moderate-to-severe cases, while TENS and MENS were equally effective in improving functional mouth opening. MENS had fewer side effects (e.g., no tingling or paresthesia) compared to TENS.
population_specificity: Patients with temporomandibular disorders (TMDs), divided into subgroups based on pain severity (VAS scores).
effective_dosage: TENS and MENS administered for 20 minutes per session, with frequencies adjusted based on VAS scores (0-5 or 5+).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy of electroacupuncture (EA) and transcutaneous electric nerve stimulation (TENS) for treating functional constipation.
results_summary: The study found that both EA and TENS were effective for functional constipation, with primary outcomes measured by increased bowel movements and secondary outcomes including improved stool character, reduced defecation difficulty, and better quality of life. However, the abstract does not provide specific comparative efficacy results between EA and TENS.
population_specificity: Individuals with functional constipation (n=102, 51 per group).
effective_dosage: 3 times per week for 8 weeks (specific stimulation parameters not detailed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of transcutaneous electric nerve stimulation (TENS) compared to low-level laser therapy (LLL) and placebo in improving symptoms of temporomandibular joint disorders (TMDs).
results_summary: TENS showed significant reductions in pain and tenderness, as well as improved mouth-opening ability compared to placebo groups, with effects persisting at one-month follow-up. However, no significant difference was found between TENS and placebo for maximum mouth-opening by the study's end.
population_specificity: 40 patients diagnosed with temporomandibular disorders.
study_duration: Intervention duration not explicitly stated, but follow-up was one month after sessions.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether burst TENS reduces pain after total knee arthroplasty (TKA) and whether it produces analgesic tolerance after 4-5 days of treatment.
results_summary: The study found no significant difference in pain relief between burst TENS and sham TENS groups after TKA, nor did it observe analgesic tolerance over time.
population_specificity: Patients undergoing total knee arthroplasty (TKA).
effective_dosage: Applied daily during continuous passive mobilization (specific parameters not detailed).
study_duration: Daily during hospitalization (exact duration not specified).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to systematically determine the effect of transcutaneous electric nerve stimulation over acupoints (Acu-TENS) on chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD).
results_summary: The study will summarize current evidence on Acu-TENS's efficacy in improving exercise capacity, breathlessness, quality of life, and lung function in COPD patients, but specific results are not yet detailed in the abstract.
population_specificity: Patients with chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare opioid utilization and costs between chronic low back pain patients treated with TENS and a matched group without TENS over one year.
results_summary: TENS treatment resulted in significantly fewer patients requiring opioids, lower opioid costs, and reduced opioid prescription refills compared to non-TENS patients. The TENS group also had fewer pharmacy utilization events and lower associated costs.
population_specificity: Medicare supplemental administrative claims database patients with at least two ICD-9-CM coded claims for low back pain in a three-month period.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effectiveness of Transcutaneous Electric Nerve Stimulation (TENS) for managing cancer-related pain in adults.
results_summary: The review found inconclusive results due to limited and heterogeneous RCTs. One study suggested TENS may improve bone pain on movement, while others showed no significant differences between TENS and placebo or sham treatments.
population_specificity: Adults with cancer-related pain, including breast cancer treatment-related chronic pain and palliative care patients.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of transcutaneous electric nerve stimulation (TENS) versus intra-articular hyaluronic acid (HA) injections in improving pain and functional outcomes for knee osteoarthritis patients.
results_summary: The TENS group showed significantly greater improvements in pain (VAS) and functional ability (Lequesne index) compared to the HA group at 2 weeks and 3 months post-treatment.
population_specificity: Patients with knee osteoarthritis, aged 51-80 years.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the therapeutic effect of an NSAID patch alone versus combined with TENS, a heating pad, or topical capsaicin in treating myofascial pain syndrome of the upper trapezius.
results_summary: The study found no significant difference in pain reduction between the NSAID patch alone and the combination therapies, including TENS, though a trend was noted at day 14. No significant differences were observed in other clinical variables.
population_specificity: Patients with myofascial pain syndrome (MPS) of the upper trapezius (N=99).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy of Transcutaneous Electric Nerve Stimulation (TENS) in managing trigeminal neuralgia.
results_summary: TENS significantly reduced pain scores on both the Visual Analogue Scale (VAS) and Verbal Pain Scale (VPS) at 1-month and 3-month follow-ups, with no reported side effects. Functional outcomes for daily activities also improved considerably.
population_specificity: 30 patients with confirmed trigeminal neuralgia.
effective_dosage: Bursts of TENS administered over the path of the affected nerve (specific dosage not detailed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate potential sources of bias in studies on transcutaneous electrical nerve stimulation (TENS) for pain relief, particularly focusing on low fidelity as a factor leading to underestimation of treatment effects.
results_summary: The study identified significant sources of bias in both directions (overestimation and underestimation of effects) in TENS research, with suboptimal dosing and inappropriate outcome assessment being prevalent issues. Poor implementation fidelity may explain the lack of consistent treatment effects of TENS in pain management.
population_specificity: Patients with acute, chronic, and cancer pain (from 38 studies included in Cochrane systematic reviews).

study_goal: To assess the effectiveness of extraoral transcutaneous electric nerve stimulation (TENS) in stimulating salivary function in healthy adults and determine age- and gender-dependent changes in salivary flow rates.
results_summary: TENS significantly increased parotid salivary flow in both age groups, with younger subjects producing more saliva. No gender-related differences were observed, and side effects were minimal and transient.
population_specificity: Healthy adults divided into two age groups (20-40 and ≥60 years).
study_duration: Saliva collection periods of 5 minutes each for unstimulated and stimulated conditions.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effectiveness of Transcutaneous Electric Nerve Stimulation (TENS) for managing cancer-related pain in adults.
results_summary: The review found no significant differences between TENS and placebo in two small, heterogeneous RCTs, concluding that the evidence is inconclusive due to insufficient suitable studies.
population_specificity: Adults with cancer-related pain, including breast cancer treatment-related chronic pain and palliative care patients.

study_goal: To determine if transcutaneous electric nerve stimulation (TENS) is effective in treating pain in neurologic disorders, specifically chronic low back pain and painful diabetic neuropathy.
results_summary: TENS was found ineffective for chronic low back pain (based on Class I studies) but probably effective for painful diabetic neuropathy (based on Class II studies). Conflicting evidence exists for chronic low back pain, with some studies showing benefit and others not.
population_specificity: Patients with chronic low back pain and painful diabetic neuropathy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the efficacy of transcutaneous electric nerve stimulation (TENS) in relieving postthoracotomy pain compared to patient-controlled intravenous morphine.
results_summary: TENS provided comparable pain relief to morphine in the first three days post-surgery and significantly better pain relief from the fourth day onward, lasting up to two months. It also reduced analgesic requirements from day 5 to 60 without noticeable side effects.
population_specificity: Forty patients scheduled for posterolateral thoracotomy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the mechanism of action of high-frequency (130 Hz) and low-frequency (10 Hz) transcutaneous electric nerve stimulation (TENS) in reducing hyperalgesia in a carrageenan-induced inflammation model in rats.
results_summary: Both high-frequency (HF) and low-frequency (LF) TENS completely inhibited carrageenan-induced hyperalgesia. LF TENS's analgesic effect was reversed by naltrexone, suggesting opioid involvement, while HF TENS's effect was not. LF TENS had a longer-lasting analgesic effect than HF TENS.
population_specificity: Rats with carrageenan-induced paw inflammation.
effective_dosage: HF TENS (130 Hz), LF TENS (10 Hz), applied for 20 minutes.
interactions: Naltrexone reversed LF TENS's effect but did not affect HF TENS.

study_goal: To determine whether repeated administration of modulating frequency TENS prevents the development of analgesic tolerance in rats with induced knee joint inflammation.
results_summary: TENS initially reversed reduced paw and joint withdrawal thresholds, but by the tenth day, repeated administration no longer reversed these thresholds, indicating opioid tolerance development. Modulating frequency TENS delayed tolerance by approximately 5 days compared to single-frequency TENS.
population_specificity: Adult male Sprague-Dawley rats (N=36) with induced knee joint inflammation.
effective_dosage: Mixed-frequency (4Hz and 100Hz) or alternating-frequency (4Hz one day, 100Hz the next) TENS at sensory intensity and 100µs pulse duration, administered daily for 20 minutes.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess whether micro-TENS therapy was more effective than placebo in reducing neuropathic pain in patients with painful diabetic neuropathy (PDN).
results_summary: The study found no statistically significant difference in pain reduction between the micro-TENS and placebo groups, with 6/21 responders in the verum group vs. 10/19 in the placebo group. The median pain disability index (PDI) showed similar reductions in both groups (23% vs. 25%).
population_specificity: Diabetic patients with painful diabetic neuropathy (22 in the verum group, 19 in the placebo group).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether bidirectional modulated sine waves (BMW) in transcutaneous electric nerve stimulation (TENS) provide pain relief for chronic low back pain compared to conventional pulsed waves and sham treatment.
results_summary: TENS with BMWs showed significant immediate pain reduction compared to sham treatment, but repeated weekly treatments over 5 weeks did not yield statistically significant long-term effects compared to sham TENS plus massage.
population_specificity: 28 patients with chronic back pain (initial comparison), 21 patients (repeated treatment investigation).

study_goal: To determine the release pattern of serotonin and noradrenaline in the spinal cord in response to low- or high-frequency transcutaneous electric nerve stimulation (TENS).
results_summary: Low-frequency TENS significantly increased serotonin concentrations during and after treatment, while high-frequency TENS had no effect on serotonin or noradrenaline levels. The findings suggest low-frequency TENS may produce antihyperalgesia via serotonin receptor activation.
population_specificity: Male Sprague-Dawley rats (250-350 g) with induced knee joint inflammation.
effective_dosage: 20 minutes at sensory intensity with 100-μs pulse duration (4 Hz for low-frequency, 100 Hz for high-frequency).

study_goal: To compare the hypoalgesic effects of alternating frequency TENS (2/100Hz) versus fixed frequency TENS (2Hz or 100Hz) in healthy participants.
results_summary: Alternating frequency TENS significantly increased heat pain thresholds (HPT), while 100Hz TENS produced a larger increase in mechanical pain thresholds (MPT). Both alternating and 100Hz stimulation showed significant hypoalgesic effects compared to control.
population_specificity: 64 healthy volunteers (32 men, 32 women; mean age ~28 years).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness and safety of standard high-frequency TENS (ST-TENS) and acupuncture-like TENS (AL-TENS) in reducing pain in patients with rheumatoid arthritis.
results_summary: Both ST-TENS and AL-TENS significantly reduced pain levels (48.6% and 40.8% respectively on VAS), with no statistical difference between the two methods. The hypoalgesic effect was slightly longer for AL-TENS, though not statistically significant, and side effects were negligible.
population_specificity: 33 patients (26 women, 7 men) with long-standing rheumatoid arthritis (average disease duration 10.7 years).
effective_dosage: ST-TENS at 75 Hz and AL-TENS at 4 Hz, applied to contralateral joints.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the relationship between axon terminal neurotransmitter content in the dorsal horn and allodynia in neuropathic rats treated with high-frequency transcutaneous electric nerve stimulation (TENS).
results_summary: The study found no difference in mean thermal and mechanical allodynia between TENS-treated and untreated rats with chronic constriction injury, but identified a significant relationship between mechanical allodynia and dorsal horn glutamate/glycine levels in TENS-treated rats. Daily TENS reduced axon terminal aspartate, glutamate, and glycine levels bilaterally in neuropathic rats.
population_specificity: Adult male Sprague-Dawley rats (150-165g) with chronic constriction injury to the right sciatic nerve.
effective_dosage: TENS was delivered daily for 1 hour.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of an occlusal splint with transcutaneous electric nerve stimulation (TENS) in improving signs and symptoms of temporomandibular disorders (TMD) in patients with bruxism.
results_summary: The study found that the occlusal splint and TENS did not significantly improve the signs and symptoms of TMD in patients with bruxism. Clicking and pain in the lateral pterygoid muscle were the most frequent clinical manifestations.
population_specificity: 24 patients with bruxism and a 62.5% prevalence of TMD.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of transcutaneous electrical nerve stimulation (TENS) using Han's acupoint nerve stimulator (HANS) for weight reduction in individuals with primary obesity.
results_summary: The study found a moderate but significant reduction in body weight during two treatment phases, with a net decrease of 2.06 kg (2.78%) in the first 12 weeks and 2.81 kg (3.90%) in the subsequent 15 weeks. Weight partially recurred during a 4-week interim period without treatment.
population_specificity: Sixteen volunteers with primary obesity, without dietary control.
effective_dosage: Frequency at 2 Hz, pulse width of 0.6 ms; intensity adjusted to individual sensitivity; administered 3 times per week.
study_duration: First phase: 12 weeks; interim period: 4 weeks; second phase: 15 weeks.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of high and low intensity, high-frequency TENS on postpartum uterine contraction pain and discomfort, and to evaluate discomfort from the stimulation itself.
results_summary: High-intensity TENS (HI TENS) resulted in a significantly greater reduction in pain and discomfort from uterine contractions compared to low-intensity TENS (LI TENS), though HI TENS caused more discomfort during stimulation.
population_specificity: Twenty-one newly delivered postpartum women.
effective_dosage: High-intensity and low-intensity high-frequency TENS administered for one minute.

study_goal: To determine the effect of TENS intensity on local and distal cutaneous blood flow and skin temperature.
results_summary: Above-motor-threshold TENS significantly increased forearm blood flow but had no effect on fingertip blood flow or skin temperature. No significant differences were observed between groups for skin temperature.
population_specificity: 40 subjects (20 men, 20 women) randomly assigned to 4 groups.
study_duration: 15 minutes of intervention, with measurements taken during and for 15 minutes after.

study_goal: To determine whether low-level laser therapy (LLLT) plus microamperes transcutaneous electric nerve stimulation (TENS) applied to acupuncture points significantly reduces pain in carpal tunnel syndrome (CTS).
results_summary: Significant decreases in pain (MPQ score), median nerve sensory latency, and Phalen and Tinel signs were observed after real treatment but not after sham treatment. Patients reported improved ability to perform previous work and maintained stability for 1 to 3 years.
population_specificity: Eleven mild to moderate CTS cases who failed standard medical or surgical treatment for 3 to 30 months.
effective_dosage: Red-beam laser (15mW, 632.8nm), infrared laser (9.4W, 904nm), and microamps TENS on the affected wrist.

study_goal: The researchers were investigating whether transcutaneous electrical nerve stimulation (TENS) could have contributed to epileptic fits in a post-ischemic stroke patient.
results_summary: The study reported a case of repetitive tonic/clonic epileptic fits in a post-ischemic stroke patient following TENS treatment, suggesting a possible link between TENS and the seizures.
population_specificity: Post-ischemic stroke patient

study_goal: To assess the efficacy of focal intense brief transcutaneous electric nerve stimulation in patients with neuropathic pain, specifically radiculopathy and postthoracotomy neuralgia.
results_summary: Statistically significant pain reduction was observed in both patient groups, with every patient reporting lower posttreatment pain scores compared to pretreatment. The technique was deemed promising for pain relief.
population_specificity: Fourteen patients with radiculopathy and four patients with postthoracotomy neuralgia.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if transcutaneous electric nerve stimulation (TENS) could improve postural control in stroke patients with spatial neglect compared to non-neglect patients and healthy subjects.
results_summary: Neglect patients showed pronounced postural instability, which was dramatically and systematically reduced with TENS, while no effect was observed in non-neglect patients. The study supports the "postural body scheme" concept.
population_specificity: 22 stroke patients (6 with spatial neglect, 16 without) and 14 age-matched healthy subjects.
effective_dosage: Intensity corresponding to the threshold of perception (TENS+) vs. placebo stimulation (0.01 x threshold of perception, TENS-).
study_duration: Single session during the postural task (8 seconds per trial).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if low-frequency transcutaneous electric nerve stimulation (TENS) could reduce blood pressure in hypertensive patients unresponsive to pharmacological treatment.
results_summary: After 4 weeks of TENS treatment, systolic blood pressure decreased by 6.3 mm Hg and diastolic by 3.7 mm Hg, with effects persisting 1 week post-treatment. No significant changes in heart rate were observed.
population_specificity: Hypertensive patients unresponsive to pharmacological treatment (n=12).
effective_dosage: TENS applied at two acupoints on both forearms for 30 minutes twice daily.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the mechanisms of vasoconstriction induced by periarterial nerve electrical stimulation in canine splenic arterial preparations, focusing on adrenergic and purinergic interactions at different frequencies.
results_summary: The study found that low-frequency stimulation (1-3 Hz) primarily activates P2X receptors, while high-frequency stimulation (8-10 Hz) involves alpha1-adrenoceptors, with presynaptic interactions modulating noradrenaline and ATP release. Biphasic responses were differentially affected by ATP and receptor antagonists depending on stimulation frequency.
population_specificity: Isolated perfused canine splenic arterial preparations
interactions: Interactions noted with alpha,beta-methylene ATP, prazosin, rauwolscine, ATP, and 8-phenyltheophylline (8-PT)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of electro-acupuncture (EA) and transcutaneous electric nerve stimulation (TENS) on plasma glucose levels, neuropathy symptoms, and pain thresholds in diabetic rats.
results_summary: EA significantly lowered plasma glucose levels and improved neuropathy symptoms, while TENS showed modest effects. EA also elevated pain thresholds, whereas TENS and the control group showed lowered thresholds.
population_specificity: Streptozotocin-induced diabetic rats

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if low-intensity, low-frequency transcutaneous electric nerve stimulation (Low-TENS) could improve motor function in the paretic arm of stroke patients when administered 6-12 months post-stroke.
results_summary: The study found that Low-TENS significantly improved motor function in the treatment group compared to controls, but it did not reduce pain or spasticity. The results suggest Low-TENS could be a valuable complement to standard physiotherapy for stroke rehabilitation.
population_specificity: Forty-four stroke patients with a paretic arm, 6-12 months post-stroke.
effective_dosage: 60 minutes per session, five days a week.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of transcutaneous electroneurostimulation (TENS) and laser therapy in treating and preventing ischemic heart disease (IHD) in patients with chronic pain post-myocardial infarction.
results_summary: The study found that TENS and laser therapy reduced angina attacks, improved exercise tolerance, and showed positive ECG changes, with remission duration in the treatment group 2.7 times longer than the control group.
population_specificity: 144 patients with myocardial infarction and chronic pain syndrome.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of transcutaneous electrical neuromuscular stimulation (TENS) on muscle relaxation and activity in adults with nocturnal bruxism compared to a control group.
results_summary: TENS treatment reduced integrated muscle signals and increased median and mean power frequencies, indicating muscle relaxation. Both stimulators and stimulation types (high/low frequency) produced similar effects, with no significant difference in muscle activity between bruxism patients and controls post-treatment.
population_specificity: 17 adults with nocturnal bruxism and 18 healthy controls.
effective_dosage: Each person received 3 treatments with both the Myo-Monitor and TNS SM2 MF stimulator.
study_duration: Not specified (only number of treatments mentioned).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of transcutaneous electric nerve stimulation (TENS) versus flat occlusal splints in treating temporomandibular joint (TMJ) disk displacement without reduction.
results_summary: The study found that flat occlusal splints were more effective than TENS, with half of the splint group achieving pain-free status or at least 50% pain improvement, compared to only 6% in the TENS group. TENS showed modest improvement in chewing pain (50% of patients), but splints were superior overall.
population_specificity: Thirty-one patients with TMJ disk displacement without reduction.
effective_dosage: TENS at 90 Hz, 30 min, three times/day.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of Electric Nerve Stimulation (TCES) in treating glossalgia (tongue pain) compared to conventional treatments like novocaine blockade and analgesics.
results_summary: The study found that TCES significantly reduced pain in all patients (100% improvement) compared to 74% in the control group, with long-term remissions (over a year in 20 cases and 3-12 months in 14 cases). Improvement was observed after the first session.
population_specificity: 34 patients with glossalgia (tongue pain).
effective_dosage: 45 mkA current applied for 10-20 minutes per session, with power self-regulated by patients to achieve slight pricking sensation.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness and safety of transcutaneous electrical nerve stimulation (TENS) alone and in combination with iontophoresis of non-steroidal antiphlogistics for treating facial pain.
results_summary: Combined TENS and iontophoresis (using benzydamine and diclofenac) reduced average pain intensity to 18%, compared to 63-81% with TENS alone, and significantly decreased analgesic consumption without severe side effects.
population_specificity: 46 patients suffering from facial pain.
effective_dosage: Not specified (benzydamine applied to anode, diclofenac to cathode instead of contact gel).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effects of TENS on pain reduction or elimination in patients with knee arthrosis.
results_summary: The study found that TENS could completely extinguish pain or significantly reduce its intensity when used alongside common drugs and physical therapies for knee arthrosis. The results were consistent across the studied population.
population_specificity: 40 patients of both sexes, varying occupations and ages, with knee arthrosis and homogeneous pain levels, illness duration, and clinical findings.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of TENS in reducing pain and swelling in children with posttraumatic knee or ankle hemarthros compared to conventional conservative treatment.
results_summary: TENS significantly reduced pain after the first or second treatment, with complete pain disappearance by the first or second day, and swelling resolved between the third and seventh day. The control group receiving conventional treatment still had pain and swelling after seven days and required additional physiotherapy.
population_specificity: 36 children with knee or ankle hemarthros.
effective_dosage: Continually applied during 3-5 days (specific frequency not mentioned).
interactions: Proteolytic ointments can enhance therapeutic effects.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to summarize the published applications of transcutaneous electric nerve stimulation in dermatology and related conditions.
results_summary: The abstract lists various therapeutic applications of electric nerve stimulation, including treatment for postherpetic neuralgia, wound healing, and peripheral circulation improvement, among others. No specific efficacy data or outcomes are detailed.
population_specificity: Not specified (general applications across multiple conditions)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if auricular acupuncture-like transcutaneous electrical nerve stimulation significantly reduces pain in burn patients after wound care procedures.
results_summary: The study found significant pain reduction with the experimental treatment compared to placebo at all post-treatment time points, indicating potential effectiveness for burn pain management.
population_specificity: 11 inpatients at a burn unit.
effective_dosage: Bilateral stimulation to six ear points (specific parameters not detailed).
study_duration: Single session with follow-up measurements up to 60 minutes post-treatment.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether transcutaneous electric neurostimulation (TENS) during premature delivery improves fetal and neonatal adaptations to perinatal stresses and infection.
results_summary: The study found that TENS in premature delivery improved fetal and neonatal adaptations, as evidenced by changes in immunoglobulin and catecholamine levels and tumor necrosis factor activity in umbilical blood sera. Comparison with spontaneous delivery suggested TENS enhanced stress and infection resilience.
population_specificity: Preterm newborns (n=25, with 10 delivered using TENS and 15 delivered spontaneously).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether transcutaneous electric nerve stimulation (TENS) could reduce acute orofacial pain during dental treatment.
results_summary: TENS increased pain thresholds, reduced ERP amplitudes (indicating decreased pain perception), and was subjectively reported to alleviate pain and stress during real dental treatment.
population_specificity: Individuals undergoing conservative dental treatment.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the safety and efficacy of transcutaneous electric nerve stimulation (TENS) for treating chronic facial pain.
results_summary: Pain reduction was achieved in 93% of patients, with 79% able to reduce or discontinue analgesics; two patients did not respond, and no severe side effects were reported.
population_specificity: 29 patients with chronic facial pain (37 nerves involved).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the safety and effectiveness of transcutaneous electric nerve stimulation (TENS) as an outpatient therapy for reflex sympathetic dystrophy in children.
results_summary: Seven out of ten patients achieved complete remission within 2 months, two showed improvement, and one had no response to TENS therapy combined with home-based physical therapy. The study suggests TENS is a safe and effective treatment for reflex sympathetic dystrophy in children.
population_specificity: Ten children with reflex sympathetic dystrophy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of combining transcutaneous electrical nerve stimulation (TENS) with iontophoresis of benzydamine and diclofenac for treating chronic pain in the head and neck region.
results_summary: The study found that a good effective tissue concentration of benzydamine and diclofenac could be achieved using iontophoresis via TENS, suggesting potential efficacy for chronic pain treatment. The actual achievable absorption of the NSAIs was discussed, but clinical outcomes were not detailed.
population_specificity: 15 healthy volunteers

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the therapeutic effects of transcutaneous electric nerve stimulation (TENS) on patients with facial hemispasm.
results_summary: TENS treatment temporarily eliminated hyperkinesis, lengthened interparoxysmal intervals, and reduced hyperkinesis severity. Post-session EMG showed no spontaneous activity.
population_specificity: 52 patients aged 15 to 78 years with facial hemispasm.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the pain-relieving effects of electroacupuncture and TENS versus sham treatments in patients with chronic pancreatitis.
results_summary: Neither electroacupuncture nor TENS provided pain relief sufficient to replace or supplement medical treatment for chronic pancreatitis. The study found no significant benefit over sham treatments.
population_specificity: 23 patients with pancreatitis, daily pain for at least 3 months, and no alcohol abuse.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of T.E.N.S. in treating cervical headache syndrome and its impact on pain and physical function.
results_summary: The study found that T.E.N.S. significantly reduced pain and improved physical function in patients with cervical headache, accompanied by changes in self-reported pain complaints. The researchers concluded that T.E.N.S. is a reliable, practical, and effective treatment for cervical headache syndrome.
population_specificity: 41 patients suffering from cervical headache, evaluated using French Manual Medicine School criteria.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the practicability of a generator set for transcutaneous electric nerve stimulation in treating placental insufficiency.
results_summary: The study confirmed the proper practicability of the method using their generator set, with initial experiences supporting its feasibility. No detailed efficacy outcomes were provided.
population_specificity: Patients with placental insufficiency (specifics not detailed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether transcutaneous electrical nerve stimulation could interrupt the vicious circle of sympathetic reflex dystrophy syndrome caused by adriamycin extravasation.
results_summary: The study reported a good clinical result in one case, suggesting that electric nerve stimulation may effectively interrupt the dystrophic changes associated with the syndrome. However, the evidence is limited to a single case.
population_specificity: A patient with severe tissue damage after adriamycin extravasation, presenting as sympathetic reflex dystrophy syndrome.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of transcutaneous electric nerve stimulation for pain relief in a general practice setting.
results_summary: The treatment resulted in complete pain relief for 40% of patients, significant pain relief for 28.3%, and little or no relief for 31.7%. These outcomes were comparable to hospital-based studies.
population_specificity: Sixty patients treated for pain in a general practice.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness and safety of transcutaneous electric nerve stimulation (TENS) for chronic pain, particularly focusing on dermatologic complications associated with conductive jellies.
results_summary: TENS was found to be effective for chronic pain, but improper use of conductive jellies led to allergic contact dermatitis and micropunctate burns. Switching to electrodes without conductive jelly resolved these issues with excellent results.
population_specificity: A patient with chronic pain who developed allergic contact dermatitis to propylene glycol in a conductive jelly.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop a composite filler (LLZTOCDs) for solid polymer electrolytes to improve ionic conductivity, mechanical strength, and interface stability in solid-state lithium metal batteries.
results_summary: The LLZTOCDs composite filler significantly enhanced mechanical strength, Li+ transport, and electrochemical stability, achieving high ionic conductivity (1.96 × 10−4 S cm−1 at 25 °C) and a Li+ transference number of 0.85. The battery exhibited long-cycle life and improved compatibility between the filler and polymer.
population_specificity: Not applicable (in vitro/material science study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare biochemical changes, including electrolyte levels, induced by six different antidepressants in patients with major depressive disorder (MDD).
results_summary: The study found significant decreases in serum sodium and chloride levels with venlafaxine, duloxetine, and fluoxetine, while potassium, phosphorus, and carbon dioxide concentrations tended to increase across all six antidepressants. The antidepressants also affected hepatic and renal indicators, lipid profiles, and blood glucose levels.
population_specificity: Hospitalized patients with major depressive disorder (MDD) receiving antidepressant monotherapy (n=1706).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop a low-temperature synthesis method for garnet-type solid electrolytes to improve material reliability and performance in lithium metal batteries.
results_summary: The study found that a disorder-driven, sintering-free approach enabled the synthesis of garnet-type solid electrolytes at lower temperatures (350–500°C), achieving high Li+ ionic conductivity (1.8 × 10−4 S/cm) and electrochemical performance comparable to conventionally sintered electrolytes. This method preserves inter-particle connectivity and avoids compositional changes or mechanical deformation.
population_specificity: Not applicable (material science study).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop a multimodal optimization workflow to improve the prediction of electrolyte freezing and electrical conductivity in aqueous zinc-ion batteries.
results_summary: The study introduced a new paradigm for electrolyte design by combining experimental data and simulation techniques, significantly enhancing the prediction of electrical conductivity and freezing behavior at low temperatures. The workflow demonstrated improved accuracy and efficiency compared to traditional trial-and-error methods.
population_specificity: Not applicable (laboratory-based research on electrolyte design).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review electrolyte imbalances and their management in cancer patients, focusing on disorders related to sodium, potassium, magnesium, calcium, and phosphorus.
results_summary: The study highlights the frequency and complexity of electrolyte disorders in cancer patients, linking them to various cancer therapies, and emphasizes the need for regular monitoring and timely intervention.
population_specificity: Cancer patients

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the cytotoxic effects and cell viability of different electrolytes (artificial saliva, Tyrode's solution, and NaF) for electrochemical dissolution in fractured instrument retrieval.
results_summary: Artificial saliva and Tyrode's solution showed higher cell viability and lower toxicity before and after dissolution compared to NaF, with statistically significant differences (P<0.05). These electrolytes may be preferable for achieving better surgical outcomes.
population_specificity: Periodontal ligament cells (in vitro study).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the anti-giardial effects of Ferula macrecolea essential oil (FME) on Giardia lamblia infection, including its impact on serum electrolyte levels and inflammatory responses.
results_summary: FME significantly reduced Giardia viability and growth in vitro and in vivo, modulated serum electrolyte levels (sodium and potassium), and suppressed inflammatory cytokines via NF-κB p65/TLR pathways. The extract showed minimal cytotoxicity to normal cells.
population_specificity: Mice infected with Giardia lamblia.
effective_dosage: Various doses (specific amounts not detailed in abstract).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine how exposure to a phthalate mixture (PHA) during pregnancy affects electrolytes, hormones, and postpartum reproductive physiology in black Bengal goats.
results_summary: PHA exposure significantly reduced sodium, chloride, and calcium levels, as well as hormone levels (estrogen, progesterone, luteinizing hormone, thyroxin), and negatively impacted postpartum reproductive traits (prolonged gestation length, postpartum heat period, abortion rate, retained placenta). No significant differences were observed in potassium and phosphorus levels.
population_specificity: Pregnant black Bengal goats (1-2 months pregnant, aged 6-8 months, body weight 10-12 kg).
effective_dosage: Standard ration containing a mixture of Diethyl Phthalate, Dibutyl Phthalate, Di-isobutyl Phthalate, and Dipropyl Phthalate (exact amounts not specified).
study_duration: Administered up to parturition (duration not explicitly stated).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of acetate- and lactate-containing balanced crystalloid solutions on acid-base status, electrolytes, and lactate concentrations in dehydrated cats.
results_summary: Both fluids normalized pH, increased bicarbonate and base excess, and decreased anion gap, lactate, and potassium concentrations post-rehydration, with no significant differences observed between the two solutions.
population_specificity: 100 client-owned cats with dehydration ≥5% due to diarrhea, vomiting, or anorexia.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to analyze the surface chemistry of ultrafast-sintered LLZO solid-state electrolytes and propose a solution to surface contamination issues.
results_summary: The study found significant surface contamination by Li2O in ultrafast-sintered LLZO up to 40 nm depth, resolved by an additional heat treatment step, which improved electrochemical performance in Li/LLZO/Li symmetric cells.
population_specificity: Not applicable (material science study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate ion transport in low-hydration conditions in LiTFSI-doped polyethers to understand the effects of trace water on conductivity in polymer electrolytes.
results_summary: The study found that ionic conductivity in low-hydration conditions depends nonlinearly on water uptake, with initial water sorption weakly affecting conductivity but significant increases observed with further swelling. Conductivity changes correlated with the number of water molecules per lithium ion, revealing a key transition point in ion transport behavior.
population_specificity: Not applicable (material science study, no human or animal subjects).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the magnitude of electrolyte abnormalities (hyponatremia, hypocalcemia, hypokalemia) among children with heart failure on diuretic therapy.
results_summary: The study found that 53% of children had hyponatremia, 47% had hypocalcemia, and 8% had hypokalemia. No association was observed between hyponatremia and furosemide dosage.
population_specificity: Children (1 month to 18 years) with heart failure admitted at Jakaya Kikwete Cardiac Institute, Tanzania.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review modification methods for PEO-based solid-state electrolytes to improve their performance across a wide temperature range, particularly for lithium metal batteries.
results_summary: The study summarized existing modification strategies for PEO electrolytes, including chain segment modification, filler addition, and other methods like lithium salt regulation and functional layer introduction, to enhance performance at low, high, and wide temperatures. It highlighted the limitations of conventional PEO electrolytes and provided guidance for future research.
population_specificity: Not applicable (review paper, no human or animal subjects).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to identify electrolyte, gas, and metabolomic markers in chronic subdural hematomas and explore their role in hematoma growth and expansion.
results_summary: The study found that electrolyte and gasometric markers in subdural blood may contribute to progressive growth and expansion of hematomas, with a synergistic effect on existing pathophysiological mechanisms. Older males predominated in the patient cohort, and outcomes were mostly favorable (Grade V on the Glasgow scale).
population_specificity: 53 patients (predominantly males over 70 years old) with chronic subdural hematomas in Cuba.
study_duration: Data collected from January 2019 to December 2023 (retrospective study, no intervention duration specified).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to predict the thermodynamic behavior of bulk electrolytes by developing a theoretical framework that incorporates asymmetric treatment of short- and long-range ion interactions.
results_summary: The study found that the new formalism accurately predicts liquid pressure, internal energies, and local ion distributions up to molar concentrations for monovalent solutions, and it reproduces overscreening and underscreening effects in mono- and multivalent electrolytes.
population_specificity: Theoretical study (no human or animal subjects)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess current practices of postoperative IV fluid and electrolyte administration and investigate electrolyte disturbances in abdominal surgery patients.
results_summary: The study found significant improvements in adherence to recommended IV fluid and electrolyte guidelines after educational interventions, reducing electrolyte disturbances from 69.7% to 46.7% of patient-days. Hyponatremia and hypokalemia were the primary disturbances observed.
population_specificity: Adult patients who underwent abdominal surgery and were exclusively on postoperative IV fluid therapy for at least one day, excluding those with heart or renal failure, ICU admissions, or day surgeries.
effective_dosage: Not specified (compared to British Consensus Guidelines on Intravenous Fluid Therapy for Adult Surgical Patients).
study_duration: Patient-days (33 in cycle one, 30 in cycle two) starting from the day after surgery.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to improve the interface compatibility of lithium lanthanum zirconium oxide (LLZO) particles with a polymer electrolyte matrix to enhance ionic conductivity and cycling performance in solid-state lithium metal batteries.
results_summary: Surface treatment of LLZO particles with boric acid improved their compatibility with the polymer electrolyte, leading to enhanced ionic conductivity, cation transference number, and better cycling performance in Li//LiFePO4 cells compared to untreated LLZO.
population_specificity: Not applicable (material science study, no human or animal subjects).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to standardize the use of electrolyte preparations in parenteral nutrition and provide evidence-based recommendations for various clinical conditions.
results_summary: The consensus developed 26 recommendations covering electrolyte monitoring, risk assessment, and supplementation strategies for multiple diseases, aiming to guide the rational application of electrolytes in parenteral nutrition.
population_specificity: Patients requiring parenteral nutrition, including those with severe diseases, heart failure, post-surgical short bowel syndrome, perioperative conditions, trauma, diabetic foot, chronic kidney disease, liver disease, and neonates.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop consensus recommendations on the role of oral fluid, electrolyte, and energy (FEE) management in hospitalized patients with FEE deficits in acute nondiarrheal illnesses (NDIs).
results_summary: The study found that appropriate FEE supplementation, particularly with ready-to-drink (RTD) electrolyte solutions, can restore deficits and shorten hospital stays. Experts agreed on the effectiveness of RTD fluids during transition care and at discharge.
population_specificity: Hospitalized patients with acute nondiarrheal illnesses (NDIs).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop an efficient and environmentally friendly method for recovering Li from waste Li-containing Al electrolytes with high F and Na contents.
results_summary: Under optimal conditions, the method achieved 98% Li leaching efficiency while minimizing F leaching (0.24%) and converting F into reusable CaF2 slag. The process effectively separated Li from contaminants, enabling resource utilization.
population_specificity: Waste Li-containing Al electrolytes (industrial/chemical waste context).
effective_dosage: Not specified (processing conditions optimized, not dosage).
study_duration: Not specified (experimental conditions described, not duration).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop consensus recommendations on the role of oral fluids, electrolytes, and energy (FEE) in managing nondiarrheal dehydration in adult and geriatric Indian patients.
results_summary: Consensus was achieved for 129/130 statements, recommending oral FEE as core treatment from day 1 of acute nondiarrheal illness and early initiation in chronic illnesses for improved outcomes. Appropriately formulated fluids with known electrolyte and energy content were suggested to enhance compliance.
population_specificity: Adult and geriatric Indian patients with nondiarrheal dehydration.

study_goal: To determine the effectiveness of ORSL® variants as an adjuvant to standard care in restoring oral fluid, electrolytes, and energy in patients with acute nondiarrheal diseases presenting with fever and/or general weakness.
results_summary: Statistically significant improvements in energy and hydration were observed as early as 40 minutes after consumption, with sustained benefits at 6, 24, and 48 hours. Both patients and physicians reported positive experiences with the ORSL® variants.
population_specificity: Patients with fever and/or general weakness due to acute nondiarrheal illness attending outpatient departments in India.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate how aspect ratio and ionic valence influence the colloidal behavior of aluminogermanate double-walled imogolite nanotubes (Ge-DWINTs) in different electrolytes.
results_summary: The study found that Ge-DWINTs in NaCl suspensions exhibited repulsive double-layer forces, leading to liquid crystal phase transitions before stiffening into a glass-like state, while asymmetric electrolytes caused strong attractive forces, forming space-filling gels with large aggregates.
population_specificity: Not applicable (in vitro study using synthesized nanotubes).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the link between vitamin D deficiency and electrolyte imbalances in a patient with inflammatory bowel disease.
results_summary: The study found that vitamin D deficiency in the patient led to severe hypocalcemia and hypophosphatemia, which were corrected with active vitamin D treatment and intravenous electrolyte supplementation. The case highlights the importance of considering vitamin D deficiency in managing electrolyte imbalances in inflammatory bowel disease.
population_specificity: An 86-year-old Japanese man with inflammatory bowel disease and multiple electrolyte disturbances.
effective_dosage: Daily supplementation with Ca and inorganic P; active form of vitamin D and intravenous K and Mg administered.
study_duration: Intervention lasted at least 80 days (hospital stay).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore how personalized adjustments in dialysate electrolyte concentrations could improve outcomes for maintenance hemodialysis patients.
results_summary: The study suggests that individualized dialysate electrolyte modifications, alongside consideration of patient-specific factors, may help reduce complications like blood pressure fluctuations, arrhythmias, and fatigue, thereby improving quality of life. It emphasizes the need for comprehensive patient data, technological advances, and patient involvement in treatment decisions.
population_specificity: Maintenance hemodialysis patients with multiple comorbidities and treatment-related complications.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the feasibility of using fungi, particularly Paecilomyces lilacinus, to adsorb heavy metals (Co, Cr, Mo, Re, Ni) from superalloy electrolytes for industrial wastewater treatment.
results_summary: Paecilomyces lilacinus demonstrated the best adsorption performance for the five heavy metals, with adsorption rates ranging from 25.38% to 64.41% under optimized conditions. The adsorption process involved chemical interactions with active functional groups and followed a quasi-second-order kinetic model.
population_specificity: Fungi screened from soil in a mining area, specifically Paecilomyces lilacinus.
effective_dosage: 26.67 g/L fungal dosage, pH 5, 1-hour exposure time, 25-30°C temperature, and fivefold dilution of initial metal concentration in the electrolyte.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop and evaluate MgO-added NASICON-type LAGP glass-ceramic electrolytes to improve Li-ion conductivity and stability for use in solid-state batteries.
results_summary: The study found that adding B2O3 (0.7 mol%) improved grain cohesion and ionic conductivity (0.21 mS cm-1 at 20°C) compared to commercial LAGP (0.08 mS cm-1). LAMGP-B also demonstrated high anodic oxidation stability (up to 4.8 V vs Li+/Li), making it suitable for high-energy cathodes.
population_specificity: Not applicable (material science study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of ringer's lactate (RL) and ringer's solution on acid-base and electrolyte balance during and after CABG surgery.
results_summary: RL solution maintained a more favorable acid-base balance (closer to normal pH and bicarbonate levels) without significantly increasing blood lactate levels compared to ringer's solution. No significant differences were found in lactate levels, serum electrolytes, blood loss, fluid intake/output, or blood product transfusion between the two groups.
population_specificity: 90 patients undergoing CABG surgery.
effective_dosage: Fluid administration during surgery and continued for 18 hours post-operation in ICU (specific volume not stated).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop a suspension-based solvothermal method for synthesizing high-purity sulfide solid electrolytes (SSEs) with improved performance for solid-state batteries.
results_summary: The study found that the new method produced uniform, high-purity SSEs with competitive electrochemical performance and excellent battery potential, addressing previous challenges like impurities and inefficient solvent removal.
population_specificity: Not applicable (materials science study).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of different fluid therapy methods (1/5-4/5 serum, Ringer's, and 1/3-2/3 serum) on hemodynamic parameters, blood sugar, blood gases, and electrolytes in children undergoing surgery.
results_summary: Ringer's serum resulted in significantly lower blood sugar levels compared to the other two groups and maintained better stability in hemodynamic responses and acid-base balance. Urine output was also significantly different in the Ringer's group compared to the other groups.
population_specificity: Children aged 6 months to 4 years undergoing surgery.
effective_dosage: Intraoperative fluid therapy with 1/5-4/5 serum, Ringer's, and 1/3-2/3 serum (specific amounts not detailed).
study_duration: Duration of surgery (exact length not specified).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of a water supplement (HV) containing electrolytes and other components on nursery pig performance and mortality.
results_summary: The study found that HV reduced mortality in nursery pigs, with no significant performance differences. Electrolytes alone had no effect on mortality, but HV combined with electrolytes showed a trend toward improved pen gain.
population_specificity: Nursery pigs (weanling pigs)
effective_dosage: Electrolytes at 241 g/L and 226 g/L of stock solution

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate gender-specific differences and the effect of combined estrogen-progestin oral contraceptives (COCs) on parotid saliva flow rate, pH, and electrolyte concentrations in healthy adults.
results_summary: The study found no significant gender-specific differences in parotid saliva flow rate, pH, or electrolyte concentrations (Na+, Ca2+, Mg2+, K+). However, COCs significantly increased Ca2+ and Na+ concentrations and altered flow rate and pH in females, while K+ and Mg2+ remained unaffected.
population_specificity: 20 healthy adults (11 males, 8 females not taking medication, 1 female on COCs).
effective_dosage: Levonorgestrel/ethinyloestradiol (0.1 mg + 0.02 mg) for the female on COCs.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to improve the performance of rechargeable magnesium batteries by addressing the passivation issue of Mg metal anodes in conventional electrolytes.
results_summary: The study found that a LiI solution treatment reconstructed the interphase between Mg metal anodes and electrolytes, reducing overpotential for Mg anode plating/stripping from 2 to 0.4 V and enhancing specific capacity to 80.8 mAh g-1 in Mg//Mo6S8 full cells.
population_specificity: Not applicable (study focused on battery components, not human subjects).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to optimize hemodialysis procedures, including electrolyte composition, to reduce mortality risk in stable incident and prevalent patients.
results_summary: The study addresses critical aspects of hemodialysis, including electrolyte composition, to mitigate intradialytic complications, particularly hypotension, but does not provide specific results on electrolyte effects.
population_specificity: Aging patients with chronic kidney disease transitioning to hemodialysis, often with comorbidities like diabetes mellitus and heart failure.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate analytical approaches, including Stochastic Density Field Theory (SDFT), for describing transport properties like conductivity and self-diffusion in electrolytes, particularly in concentrated solutions.
results_summary: The study compared recent approximations for computing electrolyte conductivity, extended them to self-diffusion coefficients, and highlighted the impact of modified Coulomb interactions and hydrodynamic effects on electrolyte properties. It also contrasted SDFT with other analytical approaches like mean spherical approximation and mode-coupling theory.
population_specificity: Not specified (theoretical study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess and compare the knowledge, attitude, and practices (KAP) among various medical specialties in India regarding the use of oral fluids, electrolytes, and energy (FEE) formulations for managing imbalances in non-diarrheal illnesses.
results_summary: Knowledge scores were moderate across specialties, with no significant differences. Pediatricians and GPs considered FEE deficits highly impactful on recovery, while pediatricians prioritized FEE management more than other specialties. MD and gynecologist prescribers were more likely to recommend oral FEE for patient recovery, but only ~30% of HCPs recommended FEE to 70% of eligible patients.
population_specificity: Physicians (n = 494) in India, including general practitioners, MD physicians, gynecologists, and pediatricians.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the physicochemical properties and interactions of TTAB and pepsin in various sodium salt media, focusing on micellization behavior and thermodynamic parameters.
results_summary: The study found that micellization of TTAB was delayed in the presence of pepsin, with CMC reductions in electrolyte media. Aggregation was hindered by increasing pepsin concentration and temperature, while micellization was promoted in aqueous electrolyte solutions. Hydrophobic and electrostatic interactions were identified as the primary stabilizing forces.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to understand the microscopic mechanisms behind ion-specific anomalous diffusion in aqueous salt solutions, particularly focusing on water diffusivity differences in cesium iodide (CsI) and sodium chloride (NaCl) solutions.
results_summary: The study found that machine-learned atomic potentials (MLPs) accurately reproduced experimental thermodynamic, structural, and transport properties of aqueous salt solutions, revealing that CsI solutions increase water diffusivity while NaCl solutions reduce it due to competing ion effects.
population_specificity: Not applicable (computational study using molecular dynamics simulations).

study_goal: To assess bowel movement improvement and parent/caregiver satisfaction in children with constipation receiving long-term PEG 3350 with electrolytes (PEG+E).
results_summary: Children using PEG+E for ≥6 months showed significant improvement in bowel movements and stool consistency, with all clinical symptoms improving except bloating. Parents/caregivers reported high satisfaction with the treatment.
population_specificity: 74 children diagnosed with functional constipation (ROME IV criteria).
effective_dosage: Not specified (dose adjusted for weight not required).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the properties and potential improvements of alkali-ion battery materials, including electrolytes, using computational approaches to enhance performance and stability.
results_summary: The study found that oxygen-sulfur exchange in alkali hexatitanates and hexastannates improves electrode and electrolyte properties, while doping Li2SiO3 with low Na-concentration enhances Li-diffusivity. Advanced simulations also revealed SrSnO3's potential as an anode and the impact of grain boundaries in nanocrystalline antiperovskites.
population_specificity: Not applicable (computational study on materials)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of boron-doped diamond (BDD) electrochemical technology in degrading p-arsanilic acid (ASA) pollutants and assess the role of electrolytes in the process.
results_summary: The study demonstrated that BDD technology effectively degraded ASA, with oxidation efficiency influenced by electrolyte composition. Novel oligomer byproducts were identified, and two electrochemical transformation pathways of ASA were proposed.
population_specificity: Not applicable (laboratory study on ASA pollutants).
effective_dosage: Not specified (optimization of factors like current density and electrolyte concentrations was performed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effect of secondary metabolites of Trichoderma harzianum cultural filtrate (ThCF) on adjusting electrolytes and neurotransmitters in the hippocampus of epileptic rats.
results_summary: ThCF administration improved electrolyte imbalances (hyponatremia, hyperkalemia, hypocalcemia) and rebalanced neurotransmitter levels in epileptic rats. It also upregulated mRNA gene expression for certain gate receptors in hippocampal tissues.
population_specificity: Epileptic rats

study_goal: The researchers aimed to understand the formation mechanism of the passivation layer on garnet-type LLZTO electrolytes and identify effective methods to remove it without contamination.
results_summary: The study found that argon annealing is the only viable method to remove the passivation layer without contaminating LLZTO, while vacuum annealing and acid treatment caused severe Li and O loss. It also confirmed that LiOH forms on LLZTO under rarefied air due to Li and O ion loss, not Li+/H+ exchange.
population_specificity: Not applicable (material science study on LLZTO electrolytes)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if laser-based processing could improve the humidity stability and ionic conductivity of Li7P3S11 solid-state electrolytes.
results_summary: Laser treatment improved the ionic conductivity of Li7P3S11 after air exposure and reduced the rate of P2S74- degradation, with optimal results dependent on laser power and scanning speed.
population_specificity: Not applicable (material science study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop a sustainable, high-performance biopolymer electrolyte for flexible supercapacitors using saline water and seaweed-derived agar-agar.
results_summary: The modified agar-agar gel showed a 17-fold increase in viscosity, enabling the production of flexible supercapacitors with good energy density (0.764 Wh kg⁻¹), power density (230 W kg⁻¹), and long cycle life (3500 cycles at 1 A g⁻¹). The electrolyte also demonstrated low production costs and scalability.
population_specificity: Not specified (laboratory study, no human or animal subjects mentioned).
effective_dosage: Not specified (study focused on material properties, not dosage).
study_duration: Not specified (performance tested over 3500 cycles, but no explicit duration mentioned).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop machine learning models to investigate the interactions between serum electrolytes (creatinine, BUN, chloride, magnesium) and acute kidney injury (AKI) in ICU patients without prior AKI history.
results_summary: The study found that serum creatinine, chloride, and magnesium levels were key factors associated with renal function in ICU patients without prior AKI, suggesting these electrolytes should be monitored for early intervention and management strategies.
population_specificity: ICU patients without a prior history of AKI or AKI-related comorbidities.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effectiveness of using high-boiling solvents (DMF and DMSO) in the cold sintering process to improve the ionic conductivity and thermal stability of LAGP-LiTFSI composite electrolytes.
results_summary: Composite electrolytes processed with a DMF/water mixture achieved high ionic conductivity (10^-4 S cm^-1) and relative densities (>87%), maintained thermal stability, and showed long-term stability in Li symmetric cells. Electrolytes processed with DMSO/water or water alone exhibited thermal degradation.
population_specificity: Not applicable (material science study).
study_duration: Not applicable (material testing over 350 hours for stability).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the implementation, efficacy, and safety of a treatment protocol using polyethylene glycol 3350 with electrolytes (PEG 3350 + E) for constipation in critically ill children.
results_summary: PEG 3350 + E was more effective (79.5% response) than rectal enemas (58.3%), though the difference was not statistically significant. Adverse events were similar between groups, and the treatment was particularly effective in children under 2 years (100% response).
population_specificity: Critically ill children admitted to the pediatric intensive care unit for at least 72 hours who developed constipation, excluding those with prior gastrointestinal disorders.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the predictive effect of catecholamines and electrolytes on the recurrence of orthostatic intolerance (OI) in children.
results_summary: The study found that lower levels of adrenaline (AD) and norepinephrine (NE) in urine were associated with non-recurrence of OI in children with vasovagal syncope (VVS), while lower sodium and chlorine levels were linked to non-recurrence in postural tachycardia syndrome (POTS). In children with both VVS and POTS, non-recurrence was associated with lower AD and NE levels and higher potassium and phosphorus levels in urine.
population_specificity: Children diagnosed with vasovagal syncope (VVS), postural tachycardia syndrome (POTS), or both.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to understand the structural and morphological changes in sodium thioantimonate (Na3SbS4) and its W-substituted analogue (Na2.88Sb0.88W0.12S4) induced by ball milling and their impact on electrochemical performance in solid-state sodium batteries.
results_summary: Ball milling induced a tetragonal-to-cubic phase transition in Na3SbS4, increasing Na+ conductivity, while reducing conductivity in Na2.88Sb0.88W0.12S4 due to WS2 phase formation. Mechanochemical treatment also altered surface morphology in Na2.88Sb0.88W0.12S4, improving solid electrolyte/Na interface contact.
population_specificity: Not applicable (material study, no human or animal subjects).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop a green, ultra-fast technique for fabricating micro/nano-structured and porous Cu electrodes using phosphorous-oxoanion-based electrolytes and evaluate their performance in CO2 electroreduction.
results_summary: The modified Cu electrodes showed increased roughness and higher current densities for CO2 electroreduction, with selectivity towards C2 products varying based on the electrolyte used. The Cu electrode treated in Na3 PO4 produced ethylene (23%) and acetaldehyde (15%) at -1.1 V vs. RHE, comparable to Cu(110) single crystals.
population_specificity: Not applicable (in vitro study on Cu electrodes).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to identify phenotypes of HFrEF patients based on sodium and potassium status and suggest a tailored drug initiation and titration algorithm.
results_summary: The study identified distinct HFrEF phenotypes related to electrolyte disturbances (Na+ and K+) and proposed an algorithm for personalized therapy based on electrolyte status and congestion. It highlighted the challenges of comparing RCTs due to varying patient characteristics and background therapies.
population_specificity: Heart failure patients with reduced ejection fraction (HFrEF) in a "real world" setting.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of a nutritional packet containing electrolytes and other components on growth performance, nutrient digestibility, feeding behavior, ruminal variables, and carcass characteristics in calf-fed steers.
